content: NOTE: This was for Discord Staff (and their personal accounts), Partners, Verified Server Owners, and some server owners with a certain revenue threshold.
There is not much information for begun or completed times. It is believed that around approximately:

updates.1684269420: Discord Staff and their personal accounts got the rollout.

updates.1684438920: Partners, Verified Server Owners, and the some server owners got the rollout.

rollouts.1686047367: Rollout was considered completed with February 2016 (Nitro) and August 2015 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686095953: Rollout was considered completed with October 2016 (Nitro) and October 2015 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686160852: Wave #1 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to February 2017 (Nitro).

rollouts.1686176873: Wave #2 begun with multiple confirmed reports of up to November 2017 (Nitro) and December 2015 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686178893: Wave #2 had multiple confirmed reports of up to January 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686247050: Wave #1 begun with a massive jump to December 2018 (Nitro).

rollouts.1686247341: Wave #1 had multiple confirmed reports of up to February 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686247566: Wave #1 ended of with multiple confirmed reports of up to January 2019 (Nitro) and March 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686263764: Wave #2 begun and ended with multiple confirmed reports of up to June 2020 (Nitro) and July 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686331320: Wave #1 begun and ended with February 2022 (Nitro) and October 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686339535: It was at this time we realized the rollout seems to be giving some Non-Nitro users the change, flipping what was going on with some Nitro users where they never got any rollout.

rollouts.1686341343: Wave #2 begun early, starting off with February 2022 (Nitro) and October 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686341799: Wave #2 had multiple confirmed reports of up to December 2016 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686343285: Wave #2 had multiple confirmed reports of up to November 2022 (Nitro).

rollouts.1686345126: Wave #2 had some reports - yet unconfirmed due to its rarity - of up to February 2023 (Nitro).

rollouts.1686347074: It was at this time we realized Wave #2 started giving access to some Nitro users who subscribed after the March 1st cutoff access to the update.

rollouts.1686356632: Thanks to two users who spotted some more January/February Nitro users around ..., we can now confirm up to February 2023 (Nitro).

timeline.content: (There were no rollouts over the weekend!)

rollouts.1686591510: Wave #1 begun with February 2017 (Non-Nitro), which also confirmed Nitro is completed.

rollouts.1686592055: Wave #1 ended with multiple confirmed reports of up to October 2017 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686699262: Wave #3 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to October 2018 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686769413: Wave #2 begun randomly with up to March 2019 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686769719: Wave #2 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to May 2019 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686778748: Wave #3 begun early and ended with up to August 2019 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686788129: Wave #4 (?????) begun randomly with up to November 2019 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686788678: Wave #4 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to December 2019 (Non-Nitro).

timeline.content: OWNER NOTE: It's becoming impossible to predict the times and waves.

rollouts.1686849252: Wave #1 begun and ended off with up to March 2020 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686858900: Wave #2 begun and ended off with up to May 2020 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686873481: Wave #3 begun and ended off with up to August 2020 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686936779: Wave #1 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to October 2020 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1686948435: Wave #2 ended off with multiple confirmed reports of up to December 2020 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1687279327: Wave #1 begun a whole hour early and ended off with up to June 2021 (Non-Nitro).

rollouts.1687473000: Wave #3 should begin around this time.

faq.header: When will I get my username?
content: There is no official timeline. This is to only provide a overview of what is going on currently.
Confirmed as of <c-timestamp unix="1686163919">...</c-timestamp>, they seem to be in two waves: one at or before 2:00 PM Eastern Time (GMT-4) and another at or before 8:00 PM Eastern Time (GMT-4).
As of <c-timestamp unix="1686788129">...</c-timestamp>, the waves started becoming haywire, so now it's really hard to tell.

faq.header: I'm in the correct category and timeframe and should have the "rollout", but I don't?!
content: Don't be alarmed! It seems a lot of people are experiencing this issue, however no one really knows the root cause.
If you're not seeing any popup yet, try these tips:
-> Try logging out and logging back in
-> Try cold restarting Discord
-> Make sure you're up-to-date with the Discord client you're using.
-> Try another device / client
Note that, because of the amount of users, you may not get it immediately and it may take up to 24-48 hours.
Discord is aware of the strange issue where Nitro users are classed as Non-Nitro users and their general support won't be able to help.
If all of the above has been tried, then you must wait. Sorry about that...
This means up to the end of that month.
For example, if the wave stopped for Non-Nitro users at March 2019, then that means everyone in that category should have it up to the end of that month.

faq.header: There are users with later creation dates who have it way after the date(s) you list?!
content: It may be possible, if one of the two conditions applies:
-> The user was apart of Rollout 0
-> The information provided here is somehow out of date. See "How often does the data / page update?" section

faq.header: How do I learn more about this change / is there another way of tracking?
content: To learn more, you can visit the official Discord support page: https://dis.gd/usernames.
I also suggest checking out hampuskraft's tracker where you can view anonymized user-submitted data to get an overview of where it's heading next! (Also, there's a neat graph too!)

faq.header: How often does the data / page update?
faq.content: About every 5 minutes. You may also manually trigger a refresh, which will reset the 5 minute counter. The data may be initially out of date as we use multiple reports as evidence, to avoid misinformation.

content: To help you understand where the tracker is, 99% of this page is in your local timezone.
To convert it or use it elsewhere, click on the time that appears in your time. You may select the text in the tooltip or double-click it to copy the UNIX timestamp to the clipboard.

faq.header: Is this official / What's your source?
content: Sadly, this is unofficial. Note that the sources vary, but sources are mainly from Discord Admins, which is an official Discord server.

faq.header: I want to report an issue / report a update / use the API / talk to you / etc...
content: NOTE: Please do not ask me when you will get the username or any estimate of such. I don't know.
You can reach out to me via Discord at @%MAINTAINER_HANDLE%.
As far as the API goes: mainly what you probably want is: /api/data/status, which gives, if applicable, any current confirmed, unconfirmed, and/or pending status.
Discord will only consider you a "Nitro User" as long as all of the following are true:
-> You had Nitro on or before March 1st, 2023 AND continue to keep it until you receive the change
-> You got your Nitro back within the grace period (typically around 3 days), if you had lost it
-> Your Nitro is NOT Nitro Basic (Nitro Classic will be honored, if you're wondering)
-> You do not have a Nitro Trial, as those were in May
(CLARIFICATION PENDING) If you were gifted Nitro after the above mentioned date, you may not be considered a Nitro user
